frameDefinitions: An Agent (the punisher or rewarder) performs a Response_action on an Evaluee for a Reason, the Evaluee's actions or beliefs.
This frame contains words that describe an Item's static position on a scale with respect to some property Variable.  ''
An Object with an understood function is or is not in a state ready to perform that function.
A Location is filled or covered with the Theme.
An Entity has a Temperature characterized by the target.
A Figure is located relative to a Ground location.
frameExamples: His <t>punishment</t> of the prisoners was too harsh.
Dried fruits are especially <t>high</t> in fibre, as are pulses.
The waters of the bay <t>teemed</t> with fish.
The pan is already too <t>hot</t> to touch.
listRoleDefinitions: <fen>Evaluee</fen> is the person or thing about whom/which a judgment has made and to whom reward/punishment is dealt. With verbs, the <fen>Evaluee</fen> is typically expressed as Object.
Typically, there is a constituent expressing the <fen>Reason</fen> for the <fen>Agent</fen>'s judgment. It is usually a 'for'-PP, e.g.
The <fen>Agent</fen> is the person doing the rewarding or punishing.
The reward or punishment given to the <fen>Evaluee</fen> by the <fen>Agent</fen>.
When the event occurs.
Where the event takes place.
<fen>Item</fen> identifies the entity whose scalar property is specified.

<fen>Variable</fen> is the scalar property that the <fen>Item</fen> possesses.

<fex name='Item'>Soda</fex> is <t>high</t> <fex name='Variable'>in sugar</fex>.
The <fen>Value</fen> is the position or range of positions on the scale that the Item occupies.  This is normally implicit in the LU.
The entity with an understood purpose.
The <fen>Theme</fen> covers or fills the <fen>Location</fen>.  This role most frequently occurs in a PP Complement headed by with or in.
<fen>Location</fen> is the object or area that the <fen>Theme</fen> fills or covers.  This frame element generally occurs as the External Argument.
The period of time during which the the Abounding_with event occurs.
The <fen>Entity</fen> for which the temperature <fen>Attribute</fen> is under consideration.
The feature of an <fen>Entity</fen> which is under discussion.
A quantity or other characterization of the <fen>Entity</fen>'s state with respect to the temperature <fen>Attribute</fen>.
A modifier expressing  the deviation of the <fen>Temperature</fen> from the norm.
The <fen>Time</fen> during which the <fen>Entity</fen> is in the state of having  a particular <fen>Degree</fen> for the temperature <fen>Attribute</fen>.
The <fen>Ground</fen> serves as a basis for describing the location of the <fen>Figure</fen>.
The <fen>Figure</fen> is perceived as located relative to a certain <fen>Ground</fen> location. The figure can be an entity or an event.
The <fen>Figures</fen> are items which mutually serve to identify the location of the other items.
The region within which a <fen>Figure</fen> might be found.  This role is exclusive of <fen>Figure</fen>, and is a reconstrual that is not possible with verb lexical units.
The period of time during which the locative relation between <fen>Figure</fen> and <fen>Ground</fen> obtains.
listRoleExamples: The boss rewarded <fex>you</fex> for your diligence.
<fex>Jake's</fex> rewards to his best workers were very generous.
If a person be guilty of impiety let him be punished <fex>with death</fex>.
The waters of the bay teemed <fex>with fish</fex>.
<fex>The walls</fex> crawled with nanite surveillance probes.
The skillet had a temperature <fex>of 230 F</fex>
<fex><t>Next to</t> the kitchen</fex> is the best place to locate your garage .

sourceCandidateSpans.text: The next few years and decades
Politics and film in Tamil Nadu
